Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This week, for the next episode of the Astrocast podcast, Paul and I will b=
e discussing several letters that were sent to the Arcadian.  One letter, s=
ent August 20, 1979, is from Jeff Frederiksen, the chief engineer behind th=
e design of the Bally Professional Arcade hardware. It seems that this lett=
er was accompanied by some hardware. The letter simply states:

"The enclos=
ed assemblies replace the 75361 clock driver, located in the oscillator shi=
eld. The failure of the 75361 is that the 6V high time after warm-up drops =
below 55ns causing the data chip to appear defective. If you do not have th=
is sinking clock syndrome, replacement is not necessary. I hope you find th=
e enclosed hardware description useful."

You can view the original letter =
here:


http://www.ballyalley.com/newsletters/arcadian/letters/letters.html=
#JeffFrederiksenLetterAugust201979


Unfortunately, this is all the informa=
tion this was included in the fabrics collection. Does anybody know what Je=
ff is referring to here? Was this fix to the clock driver included on later=
 releases of the Astrocade motherboard?

Adam

--_000_BLUPR16MB0387BA8D952B4C046F88EBB5C8750BLUPR16MB0387namp_

This week, for the nex=
t episode of the Astrocast podcast, Paul and I will be discussing several l=
etters that were sent to the
<i>Arcadian</i>.  One letter, sent August=
 20, 1979, is from Jeff Frederiksen, the chief engineer behind the design o=
f the Bally Professional Arcade hardware. It seems that this letter was acc=
ompanied by some hardware. The letter simply states:<br>
<br>
"The enc=
losed assemblies replace the 75361 clock driver, located in the oscillator =
shield. The failure of the 75361 is that the 6V high time after warm-up dro=
ps below 55ns causing the data chip to appear defective. If you do not have=
 this sinking clock syndrome,
 replacement is not necessary. I hope you fin=
d the enclosed hardware description useful."<br>
<br>
You can view the=
 original letter here:<br>
<br>
<p><a href=3D"http://www.ballyalley.com/new=
sletters/arcadian/letters/letters.html#JeffFrederiksenLetterAugust201979" c=
lass=3D"OWAAutoLink" id=3D"LPlnk934532" previewremoved=3D"true" tabindex=3D=
"-1" disabled=3D"true">http://www.ballyalley.com/newsletters/arcadian/lette=
rs/letters.html#JeffFrederiksenLetterAugust201979</a></p>
<p><br>
</p>
Unfo=
rtunately, this is all the information this was included in the fabrics col=
lection. Does anybody know what Jeff is referring to here? Was this fix to =
the clock driver included on later releases of the Astrocade motherboard?<b=
r>
<br>
Adam<br>
</div>
</body>
</html>
